body_html:
Closing this out as it seems you've figured out the problem and updated the answer on StackOverflow.

As you gathered, in the code snippet above you were creating a new session and then calling sess.run(tf.global_variables_initializer()) which would re-initialize all variables to random values instead of using the values saved in the checkpoint.
body_text:
Closing this out as it seems you've figured out the problem and updated the answer on StackOverflow.
As you gathered, in the code snippet above you were creating a new session and then calling sess.run(tf.global_variables_initializer()) which would re-initialize all variables to random values instead of using the values saved in the checkpoint.
body:
Closing this out as it seems you've figured out the problem and [updated the answer on StackOverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/a/48868312).

As you gathered, in the code snippet above you were creating a new session and then calling `sess.run(tf.global_variables_initializer())` which would re-initialize all variables to random values instead of using the values saved in the checkpoint.
